result.execSummary:
The defendant Craig J. Spangler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Craig J. Spangler is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Craig J. Spangler was found guilty of 4th Degree Sexual Assault [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with victim.  DOC shall promptly notify the Court, in writing, of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.  No sex registry is required.

Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
Court reporter transcript invoice for sentencing 10/16/15 paid by county $28.64
deft placed on probation

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty John Ward.  Court has received the plea hrg transcript and finds there was no breach of the plea agreement.  Atty Ward notes his objection for the record.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for two years consecutive to previously imposed sentences.  See conditions.  Appeal rights.  No sex registry is required.
Sentencing Hrg - 10/16/15
Copy of PSI from 12CF961

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty John A. Ward.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  During ADA Krejcarek's sentencing remarks, Atty Ward objects and believes the State has breached the plea agreement.  Court takes the matter under advisement.  Atty Krejcarek has not completed her remarks.  Sentencing hearing to continue 11/5/15 at 10:30.  Bond continued.
AMENDED
Clerk Lehman sent an email to Agent Deschner requesting an update on the deft's probation prior to his sentencing date

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty John Ward & Atty Bryant McFadden.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  Amended information filed.  Deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Count 2 is dismissed on State's motion.  Sentencing set over to 10/16/15 @ 9:30am.  Court wishes to review the PSI from 12CF961.  Court would also like an update from P&P agent.
from ADA Delgado

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty John Ward.   Court w/draws its motion.    State files an amended criminal complaint.  Court finds probable cause exists and binds the case over.  Defense moves to dismiss count 3; arguments heard.  Court denies the motion to dismiss count 3.  FPT set for 9/16/15 @ 1:15pm, JS 9/28/15 @ 9am.
of the Court
Revocation Summary

Defendant Craig J. Spangler appeared with Attorney John Anthony Ward.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Andrew Joseph Burgoyne appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Atty Burgoyne called witness KSD Detective Hackbarth; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Ward. ST moves for bind over; probable cause found, bound over for trial. Plea of Not Guilty entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 09:20 am.

113pm
  Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney John A Ward.  Clerk LE.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on 7/16/15 @ 830am.  Bond Continued.

105 P.M.  Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in custody.  Clk  LE.  Initial appearance adjourned to 6/29/15 @ 1:00pm w/Comm Mason, 927-54th Street, Rm 157, Kenosha, WI.  Warrant vacated. Temp $1000 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).

*No Contact w/B.O. (dob 4/12/99), Z.G. (dob 12/8/98), Michael O, John L, or any of their residences.
